website_summaries.verdict: Other than some niggling design complaints, the Asus G73JH-RBBX05 is an excellent, well-priced, high-performance desktop replacement for gaming or other demanding tasks.
cons: Smallish keyboard for the laptop's size

customer_reviews.title: Overheated
customer_reviews.text: I brought this computer last year, hoping to find something I can use for gaming and for college. After about two weeks, it began having issues, and started to freeze after about 30 minutes of using it. I won't lie - for a week, it worked perfectly, and it was a great computer. The speaker was great, the specs were fantastic for being an older model, and it was a good computer for the price. However, because of the overheating issue, it is unusable now.
customer_reviews.author: Lauren Davis

customer_reviews.title: Very happy with this item
customer_reviews.text: I am very happy with this ROG gaming laptop from Mauricekk. Thou it's a older ROG,works great with Windows 10, and so far every game I have installed on it, SWTOR, WOW, etc has worked great.
customer_reviews.author: Ray

customer_reviews.title: Good product.  Good experience with seller.
customer_reviews.text: This is an awesome gaming laptop. Runs well, plays games smoothly, and importantly, service/responsiveness from the seller was good. There was a windows update that was a little hairy, but that’s Windows for you. Once I got that figured out the laptop has been running ike a champ ever since.
customer_reviews.author: Paul A.

customer_reviews.title: Beast machine
customer_reviews.text: I bought this laptop refurbished, but it has been excellent. No major issues so far (bought in Jan 2011). Pros: i7 processor and radeon 5870 = plays most games on high graphics big screen backlit keyboard fans on back of the computer make it so the bottom of the computer doesn't get hot Cons: Big laptop, not super portable kinda loud battery doesn't last long (I don't really use it without plugging it in though) I installed windows 8 on it and it works well too.
customer_reviews.author: splatkin

customer_reviews.title: Warning: buy this and you might not see your son again
customer_reviews.text: I say you might not see your son again because this not-so-little "notebook" is clearly made with video games in mind. Too big to be a "laptop," don't fall for the "I can use it for school" line. Hah! It's got loads of video processing power and speed, and a fine CPU for whatever the CPU is supposed to do, I suppose, though all ours is ever called on to do is Starcraft. In other words, the vendor delivered what he promised: a powerful notebook computer aimed at the video game market.
customer_reviews.author: JustAnotherRandomReviewer

customer_reviews.title: Broken Trash!
customer_reviews.text: Product showed up on time, had to plug in the hard drive, it is not secured. The graphics card failed after two weeks of use. DO NOT BUY THIS TRASH!
customer_reviews.author: James J. WilliimsAmazon

customer_reviews.title: Works for what I need it to. Wasn't able ...
customer_reviews.text: Works for what I need it to. Wasn't able to raid on my laptop. This one does the job.
customer_reviews.author: Ronnie W.

customer_reviews.title: be expected to see some problems
customer_reviews.text: The biggest problems u will see is the laptop turn off automatically if playing latest games for about 1-2 hours , it overheats, it will freeze sometimes so u will have to turn it off to get it working again and some of the pixels are dead. I don't recommend this product due to numerous problems.
customer_reviews.author: jannat

customer_reviews.title: Poor touchpad
customer_reviews.text: Laptop fast and works great, except touchpad works erratically. Had to set mouse settings to be less sensitive for it to work better.
customer_reviews.author: Danny Phillip Bain

customer_reviews.title: Good for the price
customer_reviews.text: A Good laptop for the price I paid 650$, it's not really made for very intense and powerful games but runs simple games such as minecraft and tf2 exceptionally. When I tried to play a very high end game such as one with good graphics like modern combat or battlefield or even payday, it would overheat after 5 minutes of gameplay. I would not recommend this to a gamer who plays religiously but some one who enjoys some games in their free time. If you wanted a better laptop i would suggest a razor or Alienware
customer_reviews.author: Geo

customer_reviews.title: No Go
customer_reviews.text: I had to trade it in for a credit on another computer. The CPU and GPU were damaged due to heat stress making it unusable.
customer_reviews.author: Chris

customer_reviews.title: It's good
customer_reviews.text: Great Laptop been using it for about 4 years now, but I feel like its needs a lot of maintenance, I've had to repaste the processor and video card 2 times now and maybe even a 3rd time in the near future. I need to being using this computer in a cool room if I want to be playing games.
customer_reviews.author: Joseph Lee

customer_reviews.title: Didn't even play games.
customer_reviews.text: I received this "gaming laptop" when in reality, gaming was the only thing it couldn't do right. It would always freeze during games and even with them on the lowest settings. It was a great computer for everything else, but games were horrible. To make all of this worse, Asus customer service is the worst I have ever come across. They are very shifty and try all that they can to not let you ship it back for repair/replacement. I still don't know if they will fix my problem, but I will try some more. It's still under warranty. Do not buy from this company unless somehow what you bought runs fine. Very frustrating.
customer_reviews.author: Jared Hay

customer_reviews.title: Time to move on....
customer_reviews.text: I bought this machine 4 years ago and still use it today. It's very sturdy, and you won't exactly be mobile with it. The mouse pad is the only thing that ever was a cause of concern. It's slightly erratic, and hurts to use after 20 minutes. It still gets the job done for many games now, but I feel it starting to age now as it slowly becomes more and more outdated and games become more intensive to run. I'd suggest you look else-where.
customer_reviews.author: Conrad Ingels

customer_reviews.title: Loved this laptop
customer_reviews.text: Loved this laptop. Ran everything great for a couple years, even took it to Iraq with me. It is a beast. I ran into trouble with Fallout4 but everything else it handled like a champ. It did run into overheating problems at the tail end of its 2-3 year life. but only when running games like FO4
customer_reviews.author: Derek barolet

customer_reviews.title: Waste of money
customer_reviews.text: At about 12 months the laptop started overheating and giving issues, the display started going then the motherboard died 2 days after warranty was over. ASUS refused to consider a RMA unless I pay the full price. Was a great laptop the first 3 months then just a headache. Best Buy geek squad told me they see this model coming back to the store all the time. Spend your money on another brand - this model is DOA.
customer_reviews.author: Mike @ Home

customer_reviews.title: Basically a waste of money
customer_reviews.text: Basically a waste of money, and lots of it. Mine is falling apart with only three years of light use.
customer_reviews.author: maky m.

customer_reviews.title: Love it!
customer_reviews.text: I love this laptop. It is very fast and can do some heavy lifting for a tenth of the price. Unfortunately, I might have to sell mine because I need the cash and havent had time to use my laptop to its fullest potential lately. I actually use this computer for using adobe products because it will run the programs smoothly and won't bog down your computer. It is a little heavy though.
customer_reviews.author: kyllonen06

customer_reviews.title: This laptop is a beast!
customer_reviews.text: This is big, heavy and powerful. It gets even better when you install an SSD. The hard drive bracket can be a little tricky. Check out the upgrade video by TheTechnoMack on YouTube.
customer_reviews.author: TechnoMack

product_meta.title: ASUS ROG G73JH 17-Inch Gaming Laptop [OLD VERSION]
product_meta.description:
The ASUS G73JH-RBBX05 Refurbished Notebook PC is the perfect desktop replacement to enjoy your entertainment whether you're at home or traveling. This high-powered laptop computer comes with the Genuine Windows 7 Home Premium 64-bit operating system, a Intel Core i7-720QM 1.6GHz Quad-Core Processor, 6GB of DDR3 memory, and 500GB of hard drive storage space. The ASUS G73JH-RBBX05 Refurbished Notebook PC features a 17.3" Display and DVD±RW Optical Drive. Other essential features include 802.11b/g/n wireless technology, speakers, and a full-size keyboard with dedicated numberpad. If you need full-throttle productivity no matter where you go, you'll love the ASUS G73JH-RBBX05 Refurbished Notebook PC. This powerful laptop computer offers the complete digital multimedia package, including a breathtaking image quality on the 17.3" Display, and an outstanding DVD±RW Optical Drive you can use to watch movies, view videos and photos, or create your own business presentations. Games are among the most demanding applications for a PC. This means G73 has more than enough oomph to handle pretty much every other kind of usage you throw at it, should you choose to take time off gaming. It's a laptop computer, after all – just a very powerful one.

AMAZON.COM
feature_bullets: Windows 7 Home Premium, 7200 hours Battery Life

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.0 out of 5 stars39 ratings3.0 out of 5 stars
